what: Giotto Suite object definitions and framework
title: Giotto Suite object definitions and framework
text: package contains Giotto object subobject class definitions frameworks. Functionalities relating data ingestion, basic object creation, data access within Giotto object, generics defined Giotto classes found . Applications framework convenience functions loading specific technologies found base Giotto package.

title: Giotto Suite object definitions and framework
text: can install GiottoClass like:
code: library(devtools) install_github('drieslab/GiottoClass')

title: Create a giotto object — createGiottoObject
text: See http://giottosuite.com/articles/getting_started_gobject.html details [Requirements] create giotto object need provide least matrix genes row names cells column names. matrix can provided base matrix, sparse Matrix, data.frame, data.table path . include spatial information cells (regions) need provide matrix, data.table data.frame (path ) coordinates spatial dimensions. can 2D (x y) 3D (x, y, x). row order cell coordinates column order provided expression data. [Instructions] Additionally instruction file, generated manually createGiottoInstructions can provided instructions, default instruction file created Giotto object. [Multiple fields] case dataset consists multiple fields, like seqFISH+ example, offset file can provided stitch different fields together. stitchFieldCoordinates can used generate offset file. [Processed data] Processed count data, normalized data, can provided using one different expression slots (norm_expr, norm_scaled_expr, custom_expr). [Metadata] Cell gene metadata can provided using cell gene metadata slots. data can also added afterwards using addFeatMetadata addCellMetadata functions. [information] Additional information can provided appropriate slots: spatial networks spatial grids spatial enrichments dimensions reduction nearest neighbours networks images

title: createMetafeats — createMetafeats
code: if (FALSE) { # load a dataset g <- GiottoData::loadGiottoMini("viz") # set a spat unit to use activeSpatUnit(g) <- "aggregate"  # create the metafeats # We do this by making an annotation vector which is a numerical vector # of cluster assignments where each number is named by the feature it describes. # # Here we create an example annotation vector by arbitrarily using the first 6 # features and putting 3 in cluster 1 and the other 3 in cluster 2. feats_to_use <- featIDs(g)[1:6] clust_to_use <- c(1, 1, 1, 2, 2, 2) names(clust_to_use) <- feats_to_use  # show clust_to_use  g <- createMetafeats(   gobject = g,   feat_clusters = clust_to_use,   name = "new_metagene" )  GiottoVisuals::spatCellPlot(   gobject = g,   spat_enr_names = "new_metagene",   cell_annotation_values = c("1", "2"),   point_size = 3.5,   cow_n_col = 2 ) }

title: .plot_giottolargeimage — .plot_giottolargeimage
text: gobject giotto object largeImage_name name giottoLargeImage giottoLargeImage giottoLargeImage object crop_extent (optional) extent object focus specific region image xmax_crop, xmin_crop, ymax_crop, ymin_crop (optional) crop min/max x y bounds max_intensity (optional) value treat maximum intensity color scale asRGB (optional) boolean. Force RGB plotting automatically detected stretch character. Option stretch values increase contrast: "lin" linear "hist" (histogram) axes boolean. Default = TRUE. Whether draw axes smooth boolean. default = TRUE. whether apply smoothing image mar plot margins default = c(3,5,1.5,1) legend whether plot legend color scale (grayscale ). default = FALSE maxcell positive integer. Maximum number image cells use plot col character. Colors single channel images. default grDevices::grey.colors(n = 256, start = 0, end = 1, gamma = 1). can also data.frame two columns (value, color) get "classes" type legend three columns (, , color) get "interval" type legend asp numeric. (default = 1) specific aspect ratio use ... additional params pass terra::plot terra::plotRGB depending depending image type

Giotto supports multiple ways joining spatial information selected param join_method: "shift"  (default) Spatial locations different datasets shifted numeric vectors values supplied x_shift, y_shift, x_padding, y_padding. particularly useful data provided tiles ROIs analyzing multiple spatial datasets together keeping spatial data separate. "z_stack"  Datasets spatially combined change x y spatial locations, z value incorporated dataset based input supplied param z_vals. specify z value dataset join, numeric vector must given value element gobject_list. Order matters. "no_change"  changes applied spatial locations datasets joining.
code: \strong{If shift values are given then a value is needed for each giotto object to be joined in \code{gobject_list}. Order matters.}If a regular step value is desired instead of a specific list of values, use \code{x_padding} and \code{y_padding}. Both shift and padding values can be used at the same time.Leaving \code{x_shift} and \code{y_shift} values as \code{NULL} will have Giotto estimate an appropriate \code{x_shift} value based on the x dimension of available image objects. If no image objects are available, a default behavior of \code{x_padding = 1000} will be applied. Alternatively, a single numeric value can be supplied to \code{z_vals} in which case this input will be treated as a z step value.

title: Optimized largeImage resampling — plot_auto_largeImage_resample
text: Downsample largeImage plotting. Uses spatSample load portion original image, speeding plotting lowering memory footprint. Default behavior spatSample crop smaller ROI needed plotting followed sampling process order reduce wasted sampling focusing sample space. large ROIs, crop can time intensive require writing disk. function examines ROI dimensions defined limits spatial locations plotted, decides following two methods order avoid issue: Method . First crop original image sample n values n = 500,000 generate final image Method B. First oversample n values crop, n = 500,000 scaled value >1. Scaling factor increases smaller ROI defined : original dimensions/crop dimensions larger ratio x y dims chosen. Scale factor capped max_resample_scale Control points function set max_crop decides max ROI area switchover method B happens order avoid laborious crops max_resample_scale determines maximum scale factor number values sample. values can adjusted depending system resources. Additionally, flex_resample determines switching behavior happens. set FALSE, method used.

title: Tessellated grid of polygons — tessellate
text: function generates tessellated grid spatial locations based input spatial locations. shape tessellation grid can either hexagonal square. shape_size parameter determines size grid cells bin size.

title: Tessellated grid of polygons — tessellate
code: # Create an extent across which to generate tessellated polygons e <- ext(0, 100, 0, 100) # produce hexagons with a diameter of 10 x <- tessellate(extent = e, shape = "hexagon", shape_size = 10) #> 104 polygons generated plot(x)   # same size grid, but now with a gap x <- tessellate(extent = e, shape = "hexagon", shape_size = 10, gap = 1) #> 104 polygons generated plot(x)   # square grid with a gap x <- tessellate(extent = e, shape = "square", shape_size = 10, gap = 1) #> 100 polygons generated plot(x)
